page.title: 08Caernarfon Castle
page.content: Work on the castle started in 1283 and it was completed in 1534 but the castle was never finished .The Queen's Gate was left unfinished on the inward side. It was built by Edward 1 as a defence against any possible Welsh uprising and as a ceremonial centre for a new dynesty of English princes. The castle was overrun by Madog ap LLywelyn in 1295.It successfully withstood sieges by Owain Glyndwr in 1403 and 1404. During the civil war c.1650 the castle was garrisoned on the kings behalf but was taken and retaken no less than 4 times before the final defeat of the kings men. Between 1880 and 1900 a programme of repairs and renewals at government expense was carried out by sir LLywelyn Turner deputy constable.
